alert.note: Alert for Colleton; Hampton (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 30 at 5:41PM EDT until August 30 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast South Carolina, including the following counties, Colleton and Hampton. * WHEN...Until 845 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 539 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain intensifying across central and northern portions of Colleton County as the center of Tropical Storm Idalia moves across Southeast Georgia. - Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 4 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. Water levels along Ireland Creek are slowly rising. If living near the creek, continue to monitor water levels through this evening. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Walterboro, Colleton, Cottageville, Smoaks, Lodge, Williams, Ruffin, Padgetts, Islandton, Canadys, Ashton, Round O, Smyly, Stokes, Bells Crossroads, Rhodes Crossroads, Colleton Medical Center, Caldwell, Lowcountry Regional Airport and Springtown.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Report flooding directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 1-888-383-2024 or email your reports to nws.charlestonsc@noaa.gov.
